Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tall speakers and 14-inch screens for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Q. sells various kinds of fresh fish at Elmina seashore. Elizabeth has a senior high education. She is single and has four children. 

Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish since 1971. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayuan De Oro City. She is 33 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Nieta sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 42 ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de MARKA COUNKO, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à  travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers il y’a un peu longtemps de cela. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, des tissus au Burkina, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers tels que le sucre, l’huile alimentaire, les boîtes de conserves. Ces produits sont achetés à Bamako et le tout est revendu sur place à MARKA COUNKO à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Nieta Group are all married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families in the village of Marka Counko, subprefecture of Fana, in the region of Kolikoro of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighborhood and family links.

These women have been merchants of various articles for quite some time. They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the long-term success of their businesses. This is their sixth solidarity loan. They have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

They will use this new loan to buy fabrics in Burkina Faso and also a large quantity of food condiments and various grocery articles such as sugar, vegetable oil and cans. They will buy these products in Bamako and retail them in Marka Counko to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs each. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and use part of it to contribute to the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en: Manvel G. was born in 1965. He lives and works in Yegheg village, in the Kapan area. He is the manager of a household village school. Manvel is married and has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. One of his sons serves in the Armenian Army, and the second one studies at the Kapan Agricultural Institute in the juridical department. His daughter will finish high school next year. Manvel’s wife is a nurse at a hospital. All of Manvel’s family is engaged in bee-keeping. Bee-keeping takes a lot of time for its upkeep and development; in the summer months it requires approximately 8 hours per day, and in the other seasons 4 hours per day, but Manvel is not afraid of difficulties and he is very proud of his business. To increase his family’s annual income, Manvel needs a 1,050,000 AMD loan to buy a pickup truck to move his bee families from place to place depending on the season.

loans.use: To buy a pickup truck

loans.name: Turmunh

texts.en: Turmunh is 45 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Uvs Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, who is 19 years old, is in university and the other children all go to a local secondary school. Turmunh and his friend operate a car repair business in their town. He began this business in 2008 while working as an employee at another car repair business. He is planning to buy a truck in order to provide a transportation service to supplement his earnings. Turmunh says, “I am planning to have my own auto repair building in the future.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase paints and spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase paints and parts for his business

loans.name: Diol Marie

texts.en:
Diol Marie P. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Diol Marie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Diol Marie owns and operates a business selling clothing and shoes in the local community. Diol Marie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $25 a week from this activity.

In 2010, Diol Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Diol Marie is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes, Lucy presenta estudios hasta tercer grado de Primaria.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5.30pm. Lleva 07 años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró: arroz en sacos, pollos en javas, sazonador para aderezar los pollos, racimos de plátano y maduro.

Con este crédito  de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Lucy, se siente muy tranquila y feliz y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lucy, 49, is a member of the "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty & Work) communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has 4, independent children. Lucy finished third grade. She has always been noted for her tenacious spirit and her wish to succeed in life through her own efforts. This led her to set up a food preparation and sales business in her home. Gradually, she became well-known among her customers and she tells us that, today, she does quite well. She is open for business daily from 5:30am. She has been in this line of work for 7 years and she is very pleased with what she does. She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to buy sacks of rice, crates of chickens, seasonings for her chicken, bunches of bananas and plantains. She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy ingredients like: sacks of rice, eggs, chickens for juanes (a rice and chicken mixture cooked inside banana leaves), dressed chickens for her anticuchos (skewered grilled meat snacks), as well as kitchen utensils to provide quality service. Lucy feels very tranquil and happy and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is from the town of Zone IV Rosales, Pangasinan. She is 45 years old. Flora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Flora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elygito

texts.en: Elygito tills a hectare of rice field. He is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. His oldest child is only 18. He is faced with a challenge of sending all his children to school. Because of the increasing school fees, he works hard to be able to keep up. He grows bananas that he can sell at harvest just to have an extra income. He is also thankful to be introduced to CEVI, an MFI. He thinks its program is exactly what he needs to sustain his farm. He applied for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to supply his farm with seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs it needs.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn P. is from the town of Fugo Jones. She is thirty-one years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn P.'s group.

Jovelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jovelyn's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Juana F. tiene 54 años de edad, posee 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella tiene aproximadamente 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Sus ventas generalmente las realiza de manera ambulante, sin embargo en su casa oferta también sus productos. Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, después fue agrandando el negocio con inversión y con los préstamos otorgados por la fundación, hasta que ahora tiene un negocio establecido con una clientela que la reconocen. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de mercancías. Por lo sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana F. is 54 years old, and she has two children under her care. She has been selling general merchandise for approximately five years. She generally sells as a street vendor. However, she also sells products in her house. She started with a small business of selling used clothes. Later she was expanding her business with investment from the loans from the Fundación. Now she has an established business with customers who know her. The loan she has requested is to buy merchandise. She dreams of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village bank loan. They live in Thmey village in Kandal province. All the members will use their share of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Ny S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She owns a general store in the local village to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Ny S. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Chea S., is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice on to support his family. They have three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is a laborer, and the third is attending public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Nerissa's Group

texts.en:
Nerissa A. is from the village of Maluno Sur. She is 43 years old. Nerissa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nerissa A. Group.

Nerissa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nerissa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products such as perfumes and watches in the local community. Nerissa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nerissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nerissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nerissa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nerissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She has been selling vegetables since 2006 and also sells charcoal to supplement her income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya under the group called Githunguri Wisdom, Cecilia has been able to service two loans which she used to boost her business. This has also enabled her to improve her living standards.

Her group members trust her; they have guaranteed her another loan of Kes 25,000. She plans to use this loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To add to her stock of vegetables

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a dos hijos en el sector Muy Finca, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Orlando se dedica a trabajar desde que era muy joven criando y vendiendo animales, el cría aves domésticas en algunos corrales que tiene instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando sus aves ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Este negocio le provee de algunos ingresos que utiliza en el sostenimiento de su familia, adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los cultivos de la zona. El desea adquirir más aves para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos, por lo que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona tranquila y responsable, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar al que le necesita.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 30 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the Muy Finca sector, a rural agricultural area in the district of Mochumí. This area is part of Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

From a young age, Orlando has worked raising and selling animals. He raises poultry in the pens he established behind his house. When the birds are fully developed, he sells them to the merchants who always pass through the area to acquire animals to sell in the city of Chiclayo.

This business provides some of the income he needs to support his family. In addition, he works as a farm laborer in the area. He wants to acquire more birds so that he can increase his sales and earn more income. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Orlando is a peaceful and responsible individual. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be someone who is trustworthy and always willing to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Heriberto Esteban

texts.es:
Heriberto de 61 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). El es confeccionista, desde joven el cocía ropa para poder ayudar a su familia económicamente. 

Desde joven el trabajo con ropa por eso que cuando se caso el continuo con este trabajo pero ahora con ayuda de su esposa, el horario de trabajo es variado ya que trabaja en su casa. Para asegurar el futuro de el y su esposa el quiere construir mejor su casa con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques.   

En el futuro el quiere seguir con salud para seguir trabajado alado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 61 years old, he lives in Guayaquil, near the motorway known as La Perimetral (a periurban zone whose green areas are being reinstated). He is a tailor: ha started in his youth, sewing clothes in order to economically help his family. Working with clothes in his youth, after he got married he kept on working in this field with his wife’s help. Working hours vary as he works in his home. In order to grant a future to his wife and to himself he wants to ameliorate his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cement and bricks. He hopes to be still in good health in the future in order to keep on working alongside his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh T. V. is 48 years old and has three children. She sells vegetables and fruit in the market and grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and completely repaid this amount punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND for her business.

loans.use: for her business

loans.name: Evelynia

texts.en:
Evelynia A. is from the village of Acmac, Iligan City. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Evelynia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelynia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelynia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelynia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Acmac, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Silvia Natividad

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella vende ropa desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa. 

Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, aunque no tienen muchos ingresos ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a su hijo de 17 años, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones etc. No tiene horario fijo porque sus ventas las hacen por pedido. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y con las ganancias asegurar la situación económica de su hijo. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y poder readecuarla.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 36, lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named Orchids because when it was discovered there were a lot of orchids). She has been selling clothes for years in order to help with the household expenses. She works alone and starts very early. Even though they do not have a lot of earnings, she continues working to give her 17 year old son a better life. She sells blouses, shirts, and pants, etc. She does not have a fixed schedule because her sales are done by order. She wants the loan to be able to buy clothes. The earnings will assure her son’s financial situation. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to be able to remodel it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., who was born in 1981, is a villager in Prey Ta Khab village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Roe Roem, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She also sells Khmer noodles, while her husband sells chickens in the local market where he is able to earn large profits to support his family.

Since her husband’s business is doing well, she wants to expand it. So, to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Sim P. is seeking a loan to buy more chickens to sell and will use the rest of the loan to buy four piglets and pig feed as part of a new business. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is studying in school, while the youngest one is four years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana,  région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers et de beignets. Ces femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire. 
KOUMBLE C. du groupe Tiessiri compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de céréales pour la préparation des beignets. Elle s’approvisionne en céréales auprès des producteurs et revendeurs du village, dans les environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana pendant les jours de foire, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Tiessiri are all married and on average they are 41 years old and have 3 children. They live in large traditional families in the village of Djinina in the Fana and Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They are known through their families and through neighbours. They sells various merchandise articles and fried pastries. The Tiessiri gropu is on their thirteenth loan cycle. Koumble C. is a member of the Tiessiri group and she will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of cereal grains to make fried pastries. She purchases cereal grains from the producers and resalers in the village and in the surrounding regions and she sells her products in the village and in the market in Fana on special fair days. She completes her sales in cash and credit to a clientele made up of both women and men. She foresees a monthly income of 50 FCFA which will be used to cover her family's daily expenses and the rest will be reinvested back into her business.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Bobokhon

texts.en:
B. Bobokhon is a young man who has been a farmer for 15 years. He is happily married to a hardworking woman who always supports him. She has helped him get ahead in life and has given him four children. Like most other people in the zone who depend on the vegetable crop, Bobokhon needs to buy agricultural supplies that will allow for the maintenance and production of crops up to the optimum harvest time. With this purpose in mind, Bobokhon applied for a loan of 5,000 somoni from IMON International to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizer. Bobokhon and his beloved family sincerely thank you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina R. is from the village of San Jose. She is 42 years old. Gina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina plants and harvests rice for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 37000 PHP per crop.

In 2006, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Gina is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the tenth loan Gina has taken from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. is a 40-year-old married woman and the group leader, having been selected by the five members of this group loan, located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village, Kandal province. 

She and her husband, Mr. Penh Vantha, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables for a living. With the farm, they still can't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, P. wants to start a new business. She would like to ask for a loan to buy vegetables to sell; any remainder of the loan would be used to buy fertilizer to support her farming crops. This couple has four children: one is a construction worker and two are attending the local school while the other is just 4 years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a thirty-five-year-old lady, hard-working, married with four children living together in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to improve  her household income and have her children educated as well. She deals in selling clothes and has been doing this business for the last ten years now, however she still faces a challenge of limited capital to meet   the high demand of her customers. Margret is in need of the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin N., age 37, owns and operates a handicraft business selling rattan cupboards and beds. She and her husband sell their products, which they weave themselves or order from other weavers who live in the village of Kompong Tom Province. This couple uses their horse cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all their rattan products. Khin N. has been facing difficulties transporting her rattan because her horse cart is slow and that affects how she can satisfy the needs of her customers. Because of this problem, Khin N. decided to request a loan to purchase a machine which she will attach her existing cart and then she will be able to transport her products faster.

loans.use: To purchase a machine which she will attach her existing horse cart and then she will be able to transport her products faster.

loans.name: Ramona Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén. 

La señora Ramona es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy feliz ya que de la decisión que tomaron hace muchos años han podido recibir ayuda no solo ella si no también sus compañeras del Banco. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación procreo 4 hijos dos  mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 9 años  que viven aun con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en el cuerpo de bomberos. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en la Academia Manuela Cañizares de la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser y confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos, lo que mas le gusta hacer es ropa de mujer. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00. Ella compra sus materiales de costura en Portoviejo, nos cuenta que ya son 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ramona, 45, is a member of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank which meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Ramona is a founding member of the communal bank and is very happy because thanks to the decision they made so many years ago not only she but all her fellow bank members have been able to receive help.

She is married and has four children.  Two of them are adults and two, who are 14 and 9 years old, still live with her and go to secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is a fireman.  She learned clothes making and design several years ago at Portoviejo’s Manuela Cañizares Academy.

She has a small sewing workshop where she’s been making all kinds of clothes for many years.  She makes items to order.  What she enjoys making the most is women’s clothes.  She works every day from 6am until 10pm.  She buys her sewing supplies in Portoviejo and she tells us that she’s been in this occupation for 15 years now.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.  Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a store downtown.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband. She's been the owner of an accessories and clothes shop since 2008. Because of her reputation, she has built up a good number of customers who are very satisfied with her work. She contributes with her husband to the family’s income. She is willing to have a baby in the near future, so she hopes to earn some additional income to get ready for the maternity period. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new clothes and accessories for her clients who are asking her to offer them the new collections.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and accessories

loans.name: Izz Adin

texts.en:
Izz Adin is a 26-year-old young man from Tulkarem City in northern Palestine.  Izz Adin is a wholesale trader.  He purchases large amounts of shoes and resells them to small shops in the city.  He exports other types of goods according to the season.

Izz Adin requests a loan of $1,100 from Kiva partner FATEN to pay for the purchase of a large amount of shoes to export. 

Izz appears in FATEN's office in the attached photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of shoes to sell to small shops

loans.name: Desa

texts.en:
Desa C. is a married woman who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and an Avon dealing business.  

Her husband, Antonio C., who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 17 years old. 

Desa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Desa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, fund her child's education, do house repairs and buy home appliances. 

Desa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Paraiso Perdido Group

texts.es:
Daria E. D. O., 66 años D. edad, viuda desD. hace 02 años, y con 06 hijos a su cargo. Daria es socia D. L. Ancancìa comunal "Paraiso Perdido" Ubicado en el poblado D. Izcuchaca, en el departamento D.  Huancavelica.
Hace màs D. 10 años daria venD. chicharrones D. chancho en los buses y tren que tienen como ruta las cuidades D. Huancayo - Izcuchaca - Ayacucho.
El prèstamo solicitado serà para implementar e instalar un puesto D. comida.
(En L. fotografìa, L. Señora Daria esta sentada y es L. primera D. L. derecha; esta vestida con chompa color gris)
texts.en:
66 year old Daria has been a widow for 2 years and has 6 children in her care. Daria is a member of the community bank "Paraiso Perdido", which is located in the town of Izcuchaca, in the Huancavelica department.
For more than 10 years, she has been selling chicharones D. chancho, a pork dish, to people in the buses and train that follow the route between the cities Hunacayo, Izcuchaca, and Ayacucho.
This loan will be used to set-up a food cart for this business.
(In the photo, Daria is sitting in the first row at the far right; she is wearing a grey sweater.)

loans.use: To set-up a food cart

loans.name: Leonor De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Leonor, tiene 48 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, administra una tienda donde ofrece productos de uso domestico, su familia la conforman dos hijos de 20 y 24 años. La tienda la fundo por iniciativa propia hace 13 años, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 7:00pm, sus clientes son amigos y vecinos del lugar. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar balcones y una puerta para su casa, ya que quiere cambiar las puertas antiguas y colocar en su lugar algo más potente y fuerte. 
Esta inversión será una gran ayuda para la familia de doña Leonor ya que contaran con una vivienda segura, en mejores condiciones, que por su negocio estará mejor resguardada. Los objetivos de ella son continuar en el negocio, apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Leonor, age 48, lives in San Miguel and manages a store where she offers household products.  Her family consists of her two children, ages 20 and 24.  Leonor started her business thirteen years ago and now she works every day from 5am to 7pm.  Her customers incluD. friends and neighbors from the area.

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase balcony rails and a door for her home.  Leonor wants to replace the old doors and put in their place something more solid and stronger.  

This investment will be a great help to her family because they will have a safer home with better conditions, which will also make her business more secure.  Leonor’s goals are to continue her business and support her children with their studies.

loans.use: Purchase balcony rails & a door for her home

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha López tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a su negocio de abarrotes.
Doña Bertha ya fue acreditada de Kiva ya terminó de pagar dos préstamos. 
 Está solicitando su tercer préstamo para surtir más la tienda de variedad de productos que sus clientes le están solicitando y así tener más ingreso al negocio. 
La señora Bertha depende de este negocio para apoyar a sí misma y a su hijo en los estudios.
Para mi es muy importante que no falte lo básico en la casa es por eso que yo vendo en las colonias populares de la cuidad o afuera de mi casa, quisiera que me apoyaran con un préstamo para comprar mercancía en mayor volumen para lograr subir mis ventas y sacar un poco mas de dinerito, para así quitarme la preocupación que tengo cada mes con los gastos de la casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha López has managed her grocery business for more than six years. She previously received funding through Kiva and has repaid two loans. Bertha is requesting her third loan so that she can restock her store with a variety of products that her customers request. This will help her generate more income from her business.

Sra. Bertha depends on this business to support herself and pay for her children’s education. It is very important for her that she not lack anything basic for her home. For this reason, she also sells in the most populated neighborhoods of the city and outside of her home. She wants the assistance from this loan so that she can buy merchandise in greater volume to help increase her sales and generate a little more money. Bertha is always concerned about her monthly household expenses.

She will repay this loan using some of the profits from her business.

loans.use: To invest in more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. Her two children attend a university and her husband, Batkhuyag, has a family car that he uses for transporting people to Tuv province two or three times a month. 

Enkhtya operates a variety store in her own kiosk. She has been running this business for the last ten years. In Mongolia, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, sold piecemeal to the local residents. Her store is in a good location, located near a bus station and close to all amenities. She is planning to expand her business into a supermarket in the future, and to provide a proper education for her children. 

She built a house on her land using her family's financial help, and now she needs to pay them back. Therefore she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital so as to buy more products and increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more products and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 40 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by hog raising in the Philippines. Tita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy some piglets and hog feed.

Tita has been   in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to  repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and feed.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba S. is divorced with a child. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills.
Araba sells fante kenkey (boiled maize dough) and charcoal at Abbina near Elmina. She has been in the production and sale of kenkey for eight years. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her child. In the picture, Araba is placing her hand on some kenkey.

loans.use: to buy more maize to expand her kenkey business.

loans.name: Roxana Beatriz

texts.es: Roxana Beatriz de veintinueve años de edad vive con su familia. Ella tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras, Roxana es una mujer carismática, llena de energía siempre trabaja desde muy temprano, pues al que madruga Dios lo ayuda; la personas la prefiere porque siempre los atiende muy contenta y su mercadería esta siempre fresca además de los precios accesibles. Sus ganas de ver crecer su negocio la motivaron a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como plátanos, brócoli, tomates, melones, lechuga entre otros que le permitan abastecer su puesto y satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, Roxana tiene la esperanza que cumplirá el sueño de sacar adelante a su familia llevando seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Roxana Beatriz, 29, lives with her family.  She has a fruit and vegetable stand.  Roxana is a charismatic, energetic woman who always starts working very early because God helps those who rise early.  People prefer her because she always takes care of them happily and her merchandise is always fresh and her prices are affordable.

Wanting to see her business grow motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will make it possible for her to buy more merchandise like bananas, broccoli, tomatoes, melons and lettuce, among others to stock her stand and meet customer demand.  Roxana hopes to reach her dream of moving her family ahead and providing economic security for her home.

loans.use: to buy broccoli, tomatoes, melons and lettuce.

loans.name: José Edgardo

texts.es:
José Edgardo tiene 33 años, es casado vive  con la esposa y con los hijos  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar tiene dos hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida.

Es una persona responsable y horada, le gusta jugar vóley, festejar carnaval.
texts.en:
José Edgardo is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The 'Patrón San Miguel' community bank is located in Pallaloma, 60 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The community bank has 13 members who work in agriculture, growing corn, potatoes and wheat.

José is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes and wheat.  He buys his products in Chillanes and San Pablo every month end and sells his products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

José is requesting this loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  José faces challenges in his business such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to provide his children with an education and to improve their quality of life.

José is a responsible and honest person who enjoys playing volleyball and celebrating Carnival.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María forma parte del banco comunal “El Canelo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. 
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de mermeladas caseras desde hace 2 años. Promociona sus productos en su lugar de trabajo, a través de degustaciones. Luz María cuida a enfermos en una casa de reposo cada dos días ya que el horario laboral depende de los turnos que se designen en éste lugar. 
Compra sus productos  en una distribuidora y feria, cada vez que necesita abastecer su mercadería.
Con el crédito comprará frutas, azúcar y frascos de vidrio. 
Sus metas en su negocio son expandirse y promocionar su negocio, para tener más clientes y de ésta manera mayores ingresos. 
Luz María vive junto a su esposo y el menor de sus hijos de 20 años de edad. Ellos le ayudan a vender sus productos, después que Luz María realiza sus mermeladas. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que el préstamo le ha servido como capital para invertir en mercadería. Además de la confianza mutua ejercida en el crédito. Respecto a las capacitaciones de ventas realizadas en las reuniones del grupo del banco comunal, ha podido incorporar estos aprendizajes en su propio negocio, por lo que ahora distribuye mejor sus ingresos y gastos de mejor manera, puesto que ahora no gasta sus ganancias. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Luz Maria participates in the community bank "El Canelo", which is situated in the city of Linares. 

She has been engaged in the production and sale of homemade jams for the last two years.  She promotes her products in her workplace with tastings. Luz María cares for patients in a nursing home every other day, and her working schedule depends on the shifts that they specify.  She buys her ingredients at a distributor and market, every time she needs to stock up on her merchandise.  With the loan, she will buy fruit, sugar and glass jars. Her goals are to expand her business and to promote it, in order to gain more customers and higher revenue. 

Luz Maria lives with her husband and their children, who are under 20 years old. They help her to sell her products, once Luz Maria has made the jams.
 
She is very happy and grateful for the support provided by Fonda Esperanza ("Hope Fund"), since the loan has served as capital to invest in merchandise.  In addition, she appreciates the mutual trust exhibited by the loan.  She has been able to incorporate the learnings from the sales training that takes place at the community bank's meetings into her own business, so that she now manages her income and expenses better, because now she does not spend her earnings. 

Linares is an important urban center in the region of Maule, located in the central part of the country. In this area there is significant agricultural production and also wine production, it also excels in the field of exports. Highlights include cereal crops (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce and spinach and beans) and fruit. Linares is the leading rice producing province in Chile, in fact, 78% of the national production of this crop takes place in this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar and glass jars for the production of jams.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is a widow from the town of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She has nine children. Her youngest child is 26 years old. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 30 years now.

Her average income for her businesses is PHP 12,000 per month. Belina needs support to sustain her livelihood. The loan will help her to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Belina hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Irungu

texts.en:
Irungu is a hardworking and determined forty-year-old man. He is married and blessed with two children aged four and two years.

Irungu has been in the metal fabrication business for the last five years. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy metal rods.

Irungu is grateful to Faulu Kenya for financing him and for organizing seminars that enable him to interact with other entrepreneurs. He hopes to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy metal rods.

loans.name: Chiboga

texts.en:
Chiboga is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four months, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season the availability of fish for sale is low. She dreams of purchasing a refrigerator to store fish for sale. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver is from the village Naesakovo, Samegrelo Region, West Georgia. He is 62 years old and lives with his family: his wife, Isolda and their 31 year old daughter. Enver works as a sports teacher in a local school and gets a salary in the amount of 150 Laris per month. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family agricultural business. The family owns 3 milk cows and 4 calves. Isolda produces and sells approximately 45 kg of traditional West-Georgian cheese per month at the local open market. They also have a pig and sell 10-12 piglets per year.  

Enver’s family also owns 1 hectare of land, where maize and soy-beans are grown. Each year they harvest 4 tonnes of the maize and 700 kg of the soy-beans. From the harvested corn, only 400 kg of soy-bean is sold on local open market. The rest is used in the farm for feeding cows and pigs. Total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris. 

Enver requested credit for purchasing fertilizers for the cornfields. After the fertilizing he will get more and higher quality corn and he will be able to sell more of it. It will increase the income of the family. Enver and Isolda plan to use the increase in income for a house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the cornfield.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a determined 26-year-old businessman who is married. For the past 4 years he has been selling mobile phone accessories to make a living. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have opened up a phone shop. He is requesting a loan of 50000 Kenya shillings to start a new motorcycle transport business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now embraced the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Stanley has been working hard to manage his poultry business. He sells chickens in the local market. 

To help expand his business, Stanley has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more birds and will help Stanley to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for his family. Stanley hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business. 

Stanley is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stanley who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Betis Carolina

texts.es: Betis Carolina tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio. Fue por iniciativa propia que Betis inicio este negocio además tiene que brindarle a sus 4 hijos los ingresos necesarios. Ella sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos, algunos de sus clientes disfrutan de conversar con Betis pues es una persona muy cariñosa. El financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos, polvos, ropa interior.
texts.en:
Betis Carolina is 39 years old and sells cosmetics.  She has had this business for more than 13 years.  She started this business on her own initiative.  Besides, she has to offer her four children the necessary income.  She goes out every day to offer her products.  Some of Betis Carolina's customers enjoy conversing with her because she is a very affectionate person.

The loan is to buy lip pencil, lotion, treatments, powder, and underwear.

loans.use: to buy lip pencil, lotion, treatments, powder, and underwear.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a retail shop that sells fish like milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy fish to sell. Vicenta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 51 years old and is married with five children. He is well known in the business of tailoring. His business hours are from 8 am until 6 pm every day except on Saturday and he currently employs two people to help him.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more materials and machines for his tailoring school.

If successful, Evariste hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. With any profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and machines for his tailoring school

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom attend school.  She attended school through the third grade but did not continue because her parents did not have the money.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

For over 15 years she has been a merchant.  She sells live chickens in Mozambique and in the Republic of South Africa.  She earns 20.000.00mt per month which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had a loan in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 18.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase chicks, feed, and vaccines to increase her flock and increase her earnings. 

She promises to pay on time.  In the future she plans to expand her coops and quantity of chickens.  She plans to request more loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.
texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mae de 3 filhos  dos quais 2 frenquentam a Escola. Fez 3ª classe  e nao continuou por falta de condicoes financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 15 anos, vende frangos vivos em Moçambique e na Republica da Africa do sul, onde mensalmente consegue um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 18.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar pintos, ração, vacinas para aumentar a quantidade da sua criaçaõ e consequentemente aumentar o seu rendimento.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende aumentar as suas capoeriras e a quantidade de frangos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase, chicks, feed, and vaccines for raising chickens.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar más materia prima y seguir realizando las ventas, él invertirá este préstamo en cuero, ya que es su principal material para su trabajo.
Él manifiesta que ha mejorado el negocio, debido a las inversiones por medio de los préstamos, ha suplido las necesidades básicas del hogar y hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades.
texts.en: José decided on a new loan to buy more raw materials to continue making sales.  He will invest the loan in leather which is his main material for work.  He states that business has improved due to the investments made thanks to the loans.  He has met his basic needs at home and to date has had no difficulties.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Nueva Asuncion Dist 4 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN DIST. 4” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elza. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura, tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, alfombras, tejido de ponchillos.

La señora Elza,  indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en los puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN DIST. 4” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has seven members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Elza.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: sewing, knitting blankets, running a grocery store, making rugs and knitting capes.

Elza says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for six months and she joined through an invitation from her friends.  She has a neighborhood store which she has been working in for some time.  She learned the business from her husband.

The loan that Elza is taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying groceries).  She will buy her products wholesale in La Ceja and will then sell them in her store.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  Elza is married and has four children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elza replied that she likes the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Responsables De Collique Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita Liliana, tiene 41 años de edad, casada y tiene dos hijos, ella forma parte del grupo "Responsables de Collique" integrado por 9 personas residentes de la zona de Collique en el distrito de Comas.
La Sra. Margarita Liliana se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace aproximadamente dos años, ella no tiene un local ambientado para la venta de sus prendas de vestir si no que ofrece a sus familiares, amigos y conocidos, compra la ropa en gamarra que es una zona muy comercial que vende al por mayor.
Gracias a su trabajo a logrado tener independencia económica, apoya a sus esposo en los pagos de la casa.
Su proxima meta es tener una tienda o bazar en un mercado de mucha concurrencia de público.El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para aprovechar la venta por la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita Liliana is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She is a member of the group “Responsables de Collique”, which consists of 9 individuals who are residents of the Collique neighborhood in the District of Comas.

Sra. Margarita Liliana has been selling clothes for approximately two years. She does not have a shop that is suitable for selling the clothes that she offers to relatives, friends, and acquaintances. Margarita buys the clothing in Gamarra, which is a shopping district where merchandise is sold wholesale.

Thanks to her work, Margarita has achieved financial independence. Her husband helps with the house payments. Her next goal is to have a store or a bazaar at a busy public market. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of clothing to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Louie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Louie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Louie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 37 years old and has 3 children. Marieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a egg retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

Marieta has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the eggs retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from her general store.

Marieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, trabaja en un local de restaurante en la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente vive a 20 km al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba,que es cerca al municipio de Quillacollo, la casa donde vive es propia. Ella vive con su esposo y su familia, la cliente no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos. La señora Beatriz necesita un préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda,  la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento.
texts.en: Beatriz is a 20-year-old, single woman.  She works in a local restaurant in the city of Cochabamba and lives 20 kilometers to the west of the city of Cochabamba, which is close to the municipality of Quillacollo.  The house she lives in is hers and she lives there with her husband and family.  She does not have children who depend on her income.  She will use the new loan to do some home improvements; it’s quite deteriorated due to the passage of time.  The constant rain in the city this season has caused dampness on the lower part of the house’s walls and she needs to do the required repairs.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Ana proviene de una familia humilde, es una persona que con mucho sacrificio va alcanzando sus metas. 
Se encuentra en el 3er año de la carrera de Contaduría. Actualmente se desempeña en el área de atención al cliente de un banco. Una de sus metas es ser una profesional exitosa y contar con un negocio independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Pägar cuotas de la carrera

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has owned his general store for about 3 years. He started the business when he found himself out of work and without a way to support himself and his wife. At his store he sells a wide variety of products including posters, officer supplies, cosmetics and bottled water. He currently rents at the location where he sells from and he is very happy with his business.

He is seeking a loan in order to invest in more products and take advantage of his great location. He works with his wife and they are both very happy with the results of the venture. Their dream is to save enough money in order to buy a location of their own for the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase and diversify the inventory at his store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 32 years old and married with two children. She dropped out of school at level 8 due to fee problems and she ventured into business after getting married with a capital of $400 from her husband.

Given the loan, she wants to diversify her business and also stock more goods to meet customer demand.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Dep

texts.en: Dep is 56 years old. Her husband, a wounded soldier, is also 56 years old. They have 2 daughters who work as day laborers in the village. Dep sells lottery tickets daily. If the seller can pay by cash to the lottery ticket agency at the time of receipt, this seller will get more profit, and vice versa. Now her family income is $10 per person/month. It is difficult for them to pay in cash. They hope to receive a loan of $75 so that they can trade lottery tickets in cash. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To buy and sell lottery tickets.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh A. is a single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old and has 6 years of experience in this business. 
Taleh loves growing grape vines. He would like a loan of  $1200 to buy fertilizer and garden medicines to develop his orchard, especially the vineyard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and orchard medicines for his vineyard.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is married and his wife is a saleswoman. They have 2 kids of 4 and 2 years of age. He started his own business selling clothes from home and as it went very well he was able to open a small shop to continue his business. he would like to improve it so that he can give his family a better quality of life and so that he can be a successful entrepreneur.

Antonio would like a loan of $650 to buy more merchandise for his shop so that he can win more clients. He will pay it back in 6 months. Antonio and his family thank you for your support which will enable his business to keep going and grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio es un hombre casado y su esposa es comerciante, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, él inicio con su negocio vendiendo ropa fuera de su casa y luego con sus ventas que fueron mejorando pudo abrir un local pequeño para continuar con su negocio el cual quiere mejorarlo y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener un negocio que le permita ser un emprendedor de éxito.

Antonio está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para surtir de más mercadería su negocio y poder tener una mayor clientela, él ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Antonio y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar y crecer con su negocio

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Halid

texts.ru:
Halid Mirzoeyv was born in 1985. He lives in the city of Agsu. He is married and has a child. He is a highly-skilled barber and has been working in this business for four years. He wants to buy new equipment for his barber shop. He seeks to obtain a loan from the Agsun branch of Normico to purchase a generator and other electrical equipment.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мирзоев Халид 1965 года рождения. Родилсья и проживает в городе Ахсу. Семейный, имеет одного ребенка. Этот прекрасный мастер уже четвертый год подряд работает в этой сфере. Халид хотел купить новые оборудование для своей мастерской. Он взял кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала. Купил генератор и другие электротовары.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products for his store

loans.name: Damalie's Group

texts.en: Damalie is 39 years old and married with three children. She owns a cosmetics shop. She intends to buy more cosmetics with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suartini

texts.id:
Ketut Suartini wants to help her husband as her husband is only a simple farmer who cannot get enough money to meet their family daily needs. With the loan, Suartini bought 1 breeding pig and 2 piglets. At the moment the breeding pig is only tied to a tree because she doesn't have a hut. The 2 piglets are farmed inside a small simple bamboo hut. In 6 month, she can get a net proceed of IDR 2 millions (approx. USD 210). This farming business provide significant support for her family. With the future loan, she would like to build a larger permanent pig hut so all of the pigs can be farmed inside the hut.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Walaupun dengan kandang bambu yang sederhana, Ketut Suartini tetap berkeinginan membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena hasil suami yang didapat dari bertani, tidak mencukupi biaya sehari hari. Dengan modal pinjaman yang ada, Suartini membeli 1 induk babi dan 2 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Setiap hari Suartini memberi makan babi peliharaannya sebanyak 3 kali. Tak lupa juga kandang disiram agar bersih dan segar, sehingga babi peliharaannya bisa sehat dan gemuk. Makanan yang diberikan berupa pakan dedak gandum yang dibeli di toko, kadang juga dedaunan untuk makanan tambahan. Induk babi hanya diikat dipohon karena belum memiliki modal untuk membuat kandang. 2 ekor bibit babi dikurung dikandang bambu. Dalam enam bulan Suartini bisa maraup keuntungan Rp.2.000.000,- bersih dari hasil induk dan bibit babi. Usaha ini sangat menunjang biaya hidup Surtini, bahkan untuk kedepannya Suartini ingin membeli bibit lebih dari 2 ekor. Agar usahanya bisa maju dan berkembang. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya nanti, Suartini juga berencana untuk membuat kandang yang permanen dan lebih besar lagi sehingga semua babinya tinggal didalam kandang dan bisa berkembang biak dengan baik.

loans.use: To build a larger pig hut (Membuat kandang permanen yang lebish besar sehingga semua babi tertampung didalamnya)

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Mrs. Path M., 23, is a vendor at the market selling grocery products and desserts. She earns approximately $13 a day. Her husband supplements the household income by breeding pigs and helping his wife with her business. He earns about $7 a day. They have one young child.

Mrs. M. would like to purchase more pigs for breeding and purchase rice to sell at the market to increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for breeding and purchase rice to sell at the market.
