loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 12, 8, 5 and 2 years old. Hadija is a fish and cassava seller, and she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fediria

texts.en: Fediria is 40 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10  and 7 years old. Fediria sells local beer. She started in 2008. Every day, she works from 11am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to buy more beer for her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer for her business.

loans.name: Thi Bich Ngoc

texts.vi:
Mrs Kiều Thị Bích Ngọc, group leader, is 21 years old. She sells refreshment drinks.She's requesting 2.006.000 VND to replenish her stock. Her husband is a truck driver. They do not have children yet. Her family income is 120.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program because it enables her to save money.
- Mrs Hoàng Thị Liệu raises pigs.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Kha raises cows.
- Mrs Ngô Thị Dương raises pigs & poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Kiều Thị Bích Ngọc (MS: 020028), năm nay 21 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua bán hàng nước ngọt, chồng chị đi lái xe. Hiện nay anh chị vẫn chưa có con. Mức thu nhập của anh chị là 120.000 VND/ ngày. Chị rất thích tham gia trả góp để tiết kiệm thêm cho gia đình. Chị Hoàng Thị Liệu (MS: 020029), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Kha (MS: 020030), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi bò. Chị Ngô Thị Dương (MS: 020032), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: buy refreshment drinks

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tamaraneh II. Its members are Mariama J. and Mariama F.. The former sells groceries and the latter sells garas (tie-dyed cloth) and foodstuffs. They both have been with SMT for many years now and SMT loans have been of vital importance in their lives. It helps them solve their kids' schooling problems and in the running of their homes.

Now that they have finished repayment with SMT, they are again requesting a new loan of US$ 500.

Mariama J. who is the leader of this group was born in Massingbi but now resides in Makeni town together with her husband and 7 children. Her husband is a teacher with a very low salary which means Mariama J. has to contribute immensely towards the family`s well being.

loans.use: Buy more  foodstuffs and bales of cotton

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe belongs to the Rubí Village Bank where she learned to be punctual, responsible and to save money. She is married and is a 47-year-old mother of 7 children. Five live with her. She travels every Thursday to the Ayacucho jungle where she sells groceries and vegetables at the Pichari fair. She buys fruit from the producers which she then resells wholesale at the Ayacucho market. She also has a grocery store.

Cleofe needs a loan in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles  to buy a refrigerator so that she can make lollipops and sell meat. She dreams about expanding her business and buying a car to carry her products. She also wants her children to study and to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so that she can make lollipops and sell meat

loans.name: Asatira

texts.en:
Asatira is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 15 and 5 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2003. Everyday she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Now Asatira is looking for a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Afi Akpénè

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1980 à Badou dans la région des plateaux, dame D. Afi Akpénè est une femme vaillante qui vend de l’eau minérale dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle est divorcée et assure la charge de son enfant. Pour pouvoir satisfaire ses besoins et celui de son enfant, elle doit beaucoup se battre. Elle le fais mais  n’arrive toujours pas à joindre les deux bouts.
Pour promouvoir son activité, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 250 sachets et 100 bouteilles  d’eau minérale. Cette augmentation vient à point nommé car elle voulait aussi vendre en gros pour vite écouler son stock.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1980 in Badou in the plateau region, Mrs. Afi Akpénè D. is a hard-working woman who sells mineral water in the Agoè area in Lomé. She is divorced and is raising her child by herself. To support herself and her child, she has to really struggle. She tries hard but doesn't always manage to make ends meet.

To bolster her business, she is requesting this first loan to purchase 250 bags and 100 bottles of mineral water. This increase in her stock comes just at the right time because she would also like to sell wholesale so as to move her inventory more quickly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags and bottles of mineral water for re-sale

loans.name: Daouda's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Koudaba excelle dans la transformation des céréales et la vente de moulins. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du mil et faire face à la demande.
Ce groupe basé au quartier de Santhiaba rural participe à l'allégement des travaux des femmes
texts.en:
The group Koudaba excels in the transformation of cereals and the sale of mills. They are requesting this loan to buy millet and to meet the customers' demand. This group based in the neighborhood of rural Santhiaba participates in the lightening of women's work.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mills (cereal transformation)

loans.name: Sant Ak Koluté 2 Group

texts.fr:
L’écovillage de Yoff  (http://www.sem-fund.org/yoff_fr.php) 
Après une expérience acquise avec le premier prêt, nous venons solliciter un 2e prêt. Ce fonds nous permettra de continuer nos activités. Nous allons acheter des matières premières pour  teinture,  couture, transformation de fruits et légumes.
texts.en:
Following its first experience, the eco-village of Yoff (http://www.sem-fund.org/yoff.php) is seeking a second loan. The funds will enable them to continue with their businesses, and will be used to purchase raw materials to be used for making puppets, dyeing, sewing, and to transform fruits and vegetables.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to be used for making puppets, dyeing, sewing and to transform fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 24 años, esta separada de su pareja con la cual tuvo una hija llamada Angy de 3 años de dad.  Se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, generalmente a bordar tapetes, los cuales vende en las ferias de la ciudad y también distribuye por pedido, desde hace 5 años.
Irma siempre se ha destacado por su creatividad, la cual plasma en cada uno de los bordados que realiza, los cuales son muy cotizados por la clientela debido a sus acabados finales tan bonitos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es elaborar cantidades de bordados para cumplir con todos los pedidos que le hacen. Irma se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de tela (Bayeta), hilos, etc., para elaborar sus bordados y lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma is 24 years old. She is separated from her husband with whom she has a daughter, Angy of 3 years old. She makes handicrafts, generally embroidery mats. She’s been selling them at the town fairs or making them upon request for the last 5 years. Irma has always been popular in this activity for her creativity, which can be observed on each of her embroideries, which are always on demand among her customers, thanks to her beautiful detailed endings. The hardest part of her work is to finish on time all her customers’ requests. This is her fist loan request from Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to purchase larger amounts for fabric (Bayeta), threads, etc., to make more pieces of embroidery and to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroideries

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru: Сафарова нина живет в городе Вахдат. Ей 54 года и 15 лет она работает в швейном ателье. Шьет одежде на заказ. Нина замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Ее деятельность приносит доход неплохой. Ей хватает , чтобы прокормить семью. Но для тоо, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов , а так же улучшить качество производимой продукции , хочет купить новую швейную машинку. Для этого он решила получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nina S. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 54 years old and she has been working in a sewing shop for fifteen years. She makes custom clothing. Nina is married and has eight children. Her business gives her good income. It's enough to feed the family. But to attract new clientelle and to improve the quality of her production she wants to buy a new sewing machine. For this Nina needs a loan which she will pay of within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Agafia

texts.en:
Ms. Agafia B. is 56 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is working as a teacher of the Romanian language in a middle school in Falesti district, Drujineni village, but her salary is not enough to enable her to complete working capital for growing of cereals and grain legumes, including production of seeds. It took her a long time together with her husband to save money needed for the education of their children.

Agafia is requesting a loan to purchase seeds to develop her business. She will repay the loan from her monthly salary. A future plan of the borrower is to sell merchandise on the wholesale market in the district.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Julia S. es originaria de la ciudad de Managua donde posee su establecimiento de venta de frutas, verduras, refrescos de frutas y vinagres atendidos en su local que a pesar que no está en las condiciones necesarias se ha esforzado para salir adelante en el negocio.

Actualmente ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel ya que requiere de la compra de las frutas y verduras lo mas antes posible y por esto espera muy confiadamente creyendo que su crédito será otorgado sin problemas alguno.
texts.en:
Señora Julia S. is a native of the city of Managua, where she has her business selling fruits, vegetables, fruit beverages, and vinegars from her shop. In spite of the fact that conditions are not the best, she has worked hard to get ahead in her business. Currently she is seeking the help of Ceprodel so she can buy fruits and vegetables as early as possible. For this reason she is waiting expectantly for her loan to be approved without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Hasanboy

texts.en:
Since he was very young, M. Hasanboy has dedicated himself to raising livestock. He is married and a father who needs to support his children, who no longer need his help to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with the business. 

Hasanboy needs to purchase calves. To commercialize the derivative products, he sells the raised animals to farmers who then resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals to start the cycle, Hasanboy has come to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit. In this way, he will continue to maintain his dear home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Muborack

texts.en: D. Muborack first applied to the Kiva field partner, MicroInvest, in 2009, and presented herself as an honest and reliable client. She is twenty-six years old and lives in Khuhand. She is engaged in commercial service and trade involving food products. She has worked as the bookkeeper of this business for thirteen years. Muborack is asking for a business development loan of $425 to be used to import vegetable oil from Iran. She thanks Kiva for its support and sends her best wishes.

loans.use: To import vegetable oil from Iran

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a food seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Tawakal loan group (group code 2041). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. She works at her business daily.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business, like rice and flour. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ashura is married and has three children, who are 20, 15, and 4.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business, like rice and flour.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un joven de 18 años que trabaja para ayudar a su familia, pues los gastos dentro de su hogar son muy altos y tiene el deseo de apoyar mientras pueda. Tener un propio negocio fue una idea que su madre incentivo en él, pues lo apoyó con el capital necesario para abrir su locutorio (centro de llamadas telefónicas) hace un año inicio. Todo este tiempo ha logrado aprovechar sus ganancias para seguir comprando módulos, pues empezó  solo con uno, más ahora tiene instalado cinco módulos, tiene el deseo de seguir creciendo e instalar unas cabinas de Internet para complementar sus servicios y obtener mayores ganancias, pues quiere estudiar una carrera profesional. Pero para conseguir sus ansiados deseos tiene que esforzarse y levantarse temprano para atender su negocio, el cual abre a 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 10 de la noche, aprovechando de estudiar y leer mientras atiende su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ser nuevo en el grupo le está ayudando a ampliar sus relaciones con sociales y está seguro que también aprenderá nuevas cosas para administrar mejor su negocio y sus ahorros. Con los 1000 soles que solicita invertirá en la compra de aparatos telefónicos, así como para el mantenimiento de sus módulos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is an 18-year-old young man who works to help his family, because they have many expenses and he wants to help as much as he can. His mother encouraged him to have his own business and she supported him with the capital he needed to set up his own telephone call center a year ago. Since then he has been able to take advantage of his earnings, buying more modules for the phone center. He started with just one, and now has expanded to five modules. He wants to keep growing his business and to add some internet stations as a complement to the services he offers and to earn more, because he would like to be able to study for a professional career. To be able to reach his goals he needs to work hard and get up early to take care of his business, which he opens at 8 am and closes at 10 pm. He studies and reads at the same time that he takes care of the business. This is his first loan with MFP. As a new member of the group he is developing new relationships and he is sure that he will also learn new ideas about administering his business and his finances. With the 1,000 PEN that he is requesting he will invest in more telephone equipment and in maintenance for the equipment he already has.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of telephone equipment

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells drinks and provisions. He is 42 years old and married with seven children. He hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gema Daly

texts.es: La Joven Gema Daly V. Flete tiene la edad de 24 años, es una mujer casada. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. A pesar de su corta edad Gema es la única que aporta ayuda para su hogar. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio pero es importante resaltar que su negocio nació con la idea de sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que su negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda ya que si establecía su negocio en el mercado tendría que pagar la renta y no tenia el capital suficiente, es por eso que todos los días carga su bolsa en donde contiene la ropa a ofrecer. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, faldas y calzado. El deseo de Gema es obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The young Gema Daly V. Flete is 24 years old and a married woman. Her economic activity is selling used clothes. Despite her young age, Gema is the only one that provides economic help for her household. She has been dedicated to this business for three years now, but it is important to emphasize that the business was born with the idea of improving her family's lifestyle, which is why her business is located in her home, because if she established her business in the market she would have to pay rent and she didn't have sufficient capital. This is why every day she loads and carries her bag that contains clothing for sale. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital for purchasing used clothing like pants, shirts, dresses, and shoes. Gema's desire is to obtain better earnings for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina trabaja vivandera (vende comida); tiene un puesto donde todos los días a partir de las 10:00 de la mañana vende almuerzo; el esposo trabaja de costurero en la Republica de Argentina. Los ingresos de la actividad de Celestina más algún dinero que su esposo envía constituyen sus principales fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. Celestina vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona de German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra insumos por cantidad como ser papa, pollo, arroz y otros, para obtener mejores precios y tratar de mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación  del préstamo solicitado por Celestina.
texts.en:
Celestina works selling food. She has a stand where she sells lunch everyday starting at 10:00 in the morning. Her husband works as tailor in Argentina. Celestina’s income plus some money that her husband sends are the main sources of income that cover the cost of supporting her three sons. Celestina lives in her own house located in the German Busch 1-1-2 Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan for the purchase of ingredients in bulk such as potatoes, chicken, rice, and others so that she can have better prices and try to improve her earnings.

This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed qualifies her for the approval of the loan for which she has applied.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, chicken, rice, and other items for her food sales business.

loans.name: Johari

texts.en:
Johari is a member of the Kajificheni borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is fifty-eight years old and married with six  children, who are between the ages of twenty-nine and forty-two. She also cares for three other dependents. 

Johari started her own charcoal business ten years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately $80.

This is Johari’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania, one of Kiva's field partners. She has requested 400,000 TSH in order to buy more charcoal. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Johari hopes to get more food for the family and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo se encuentra casado y tiene 35 años de edad, 2 hijos, toda la familia vive en domicilio propio en la comunidad de Huacarama. Pablo se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros afiliado al sindicato de trasportes "progreso" con experiencia de 19 años en el rubro y la esposa  se dedica a la comercialización  de hortalizas. La competencia es media, tiene su propia clientela  ya que por la forma de atender  a sus clientes y principalmente la antigüedad en el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, es el más preferido. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de llantas para su vehiculo. Cuenta con buen historial crediticio en agrocapital, por parte de la codeudora tiene antecedentes negativos esto se respalda con una solicitud de excepción.
texts.en:
Pablo is married, 35 years old, and has two children. The whole family lives in their own home in the Huacarama community. Pablo is in the passenger transportation business and is affiliated with the transport syndicate Progreso. He has 19 years of experience is this field. His wife sells vegetables. Pablo has a medium level of competition. He has his own customers. Because of the quality of his service, and, mainly, because he has been in business for so long, he is the top choice in passenger transport. This loan will be used to purchase tires for his vehicle. In part because of a loan co-signer, he has had some negative incidents (in his credit history), but he has asked for an exception and hopes to do well with Kiva partner Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Arab

texts.en:
Arab is a young woman who is married with two children. She holds a masters degree in English language literature. Arab is a school teacher and she also has a part time job as a lecturer in the Arab American University in Jenin.

Arab is a very hardworking woman who wants to improve her income so as to have a better life for herself and for the whole family. For three years, she has worked in a language institute where she teaches English. Two years ago, she bought that institute and now she needs a loan to buy computers for the center in addition to doing some redecorating. She appears in the photo while teaching some of her students.

loans.use: To buy computers for her education center

loans.name: Paubla De Los Angeles

texts.es: Paubla de los Ángeles Mejía G. tiene 49 años de edad. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde, la actividad económica a la que ella se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, por lo que no fue fácil salir adelante con este negocio ya que tuvo que realizar muchos sacrificios por lo que tenía que proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella empezó a vender en la puerta de su casa por lo que las tardes sacaba una mesita en donde colocaba ciertas golosinas y ciertas personas que pasaban por su localidad eran sus clientes, con el paso del tiempo fueron aumentando sus productos y decidieron seguir adelante. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas en general, refrescos naturales y jugos.
texts.en:
Paubla de los Ángeles Mejía G. is 49 years old. Her business is located in the house where she lives; she runs a small convenience store. She has dedicated herself to this humble business for over 16 years; it was not easy get ahead with this business given that she had to make many sacrifices to give her children what they needed. She began selling at the door of her house in the afternoons when she would take out a small table where she would place sweets; certain people that would pass by became her clients, and as time passed her products offered increased and they decided to move forward with the business. The loan that she is currently requesting will be employed as work capital to purchase basic grains, general sweets, and natural drinks and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase basic grains, general sweets, and natural drinks and juices).

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Mrs. Conchita C. is living at Catadman, in the city of Ozamiz. She is 50 years old and married with 5 adult-aged children. She is a micro-entrepreneur involved in “guso” (seaweeds) production. She started this production in 2003, with the net income of 1,500.00 PHP a month. She joined Paglaum in August 2009 because she wants to avail of the programs and services that PMPC offered to her. At her first loan cycle, she is applying for a loan of 5,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials needed for her guso production. Her future plan for her family is to improve their way of living and to live a healthy life with the help of Paglaum and through Kiva funds.

loans.use: To purchase more materials needed for her guso production

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells fufu. Fufu is a local food made from fermented cassava and it is usually eaten with a local soup in Nigeria. Regina lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more fufu to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Obiagah

texts.en: Obiagah is 25 years old and married. She has no children at present, but hopes to raise a family in the future. Obiagah is a focused, hard-working woman and is happy to sell fruit for a living because it gives her a chance to spend a lot of time with her customers. She hopes to be a major fruit distributor in her community of Asaba, Delta state. To help make this possible, she has applied for a loan for N80,000. She will use this money to buy more fruit to sell, and offers thanks to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Haliba

texts.en:
Haliba S., currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol, is requesting a loan to purchase more materials for the business. Haliba is 25 years old and married to a policeman. They have two children, both attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an inventory of soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid N. is a married father of four children. Rashid owns a workshop where he makes windows for houses and furniture. He has been doing this business for the last 11 years. He also owns a dairy cow and sells milk, thereby supplementing his timber income.

Rashid is now accessing his third loan from KADET and was able to service the previous two without a problem. With this loan, he plans to purchase timber, nails and turpentine. He also plans to buy cover materials to make sofa sets. He mainly serves the surrounding community and also makes tables and chairs for schools nearby.

Rashid hopes to build another workshop on a plot he owns and to also employ other people in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and turpentine and to also purchase cover materials to make sofa sets.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa C. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 48 years old, married, and has nine children. Five of her children are adults and the remaining four are students. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Luisa joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gladis Díaz, es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$15,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la COTRAN 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de ropa y Calzado para caballeros, damas y niños, que se vende mucho.

Es madre soltera, con tres hijos a su cargo, este se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 15 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Gladis Díaz is an enterprising woman who manages a business buying and selling clothing and shoes. She began with initial startup capital of 15,000 NIO and subsequently took out loans for the next ten years. Her business is located at the Israel Lewite Market, near the main entrance of COTRAN (one of the primary bus terminals).

The loan Ana is requesting will be used as operating capital for her business. She plans to buy clothing and shoes for men, women, and children since she sells a lot of these items.

Ana is a single mother with three dependent children who attend school. Prior to having this business, she worked as a housekeeper. It has taken fifteen loans from CEPRODEL over a ten year period to grow her business and diversify her products so that she can compete in the marketplace. She thanks CEPRODEL for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, undergarments, and shoes

loans.name: Aceya

texts.en: Aceya M. is currently in the business of selling food in her hotel (restaurant) and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell. Aceya is 21 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Alibekova Sharifahon`s Group

texts.ru:
Село Араван находится в 20 км от южной столицы Кыргызстана - города Ош. Данный район славится своим рисом и развитым животноводством. 

Шарифахон также занимается животноводством. Ей 36 лет, замужем и мать 3 детей. Все они достаточно взрослые и уже помогают родителям в домашнем хозяйстве. Ее супруг работает частным водителем с ежемесячным доходом в около 100 долларов. В данное время они откармливают доенную корову с теленком, также полученное молоко и молочные продукты она реализует в своем селе. Этот кредит запрашивается для закупа еще одного теленка. В будущем семья клиента планирует построить целую конюшню. 

Асияхан, 39 лет, замужем. У нее 5 детей: 3 дочери и 2 сына. Самому старшему 20 лет, а самому младшему всего лишь 3 годика. Ее супруг работает строителем в строительно-монтажном учреждении. Дома они откармливают скот, кредит будет использован для закупа одной телки. скот весной будет отправлен на пастбище. 

Третьим участником этой группы является Январхон, ей 48 лет. Она совместно с супругом занимаются оптовой поставкой продуктов питания местным  школам и детским садам на договорной основе. Этим бизнесом они занимаются 1 год, с тех пор, как супруг уволился с государственной службы. Кредит будет использован для закупа муки, сахара, масло для последующей реализации школам.

ТАйиржан единственный мужчина в группе солидарности. Ему 43 года. Его супруга является членом крестьянского хозяйства. Он занимается животноводством, а также реализацией молока и молочных продуктов. Кредит будет использован для закуп 1 теленка, который потом будет отправлен на горное пастбище. 

Садатхан замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. Старшему сыну 28 лет, он строитель, а дочери 22 года, она домохозяйка. У них семейный бизнес по выращиванию сельхоз культур и откорму скота. В данное вреия они содержат 4 овца, также готовять к посеву картофеля. Кредит будет использован для закупа 5 овец.  
  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The Aravan village is located 20 km from the southern capital of Kyrgyzstan, the city of Osh. This region is famous for its rice and a well-developed animal husbandry. Sharifahon is also involved in animal husbandry. She is 36 years old, married and is a mother of 3 children. All of them are fairly grown and already help their parents with the household. Her husband works as a private driver and has a monthly income of about 100 dollars. Currently, they are raising a dairy cow and a calf. Sharifahon also sells milk and dairy products in their village. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of one more calf. In the future, the client’s family plans to build a horse stable. Asiyahan is 39 years and married. She has 5 children: 3 daughters and 2 sons. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is only three. Her husband is a construction worker at a construction company. Asiyahan and her husband raise livestock at home. The loan will be used for the purchase of one cow. The livestock will be sent to pasture in the spring. The third participant of this group is Yanvarhon, who is 48 years old. Together with her husband, she is involved in wholesale delivery of food products to local schools and kindergartens on a contract basis. They have been involved in this business for 1 year, ever since the husband left a government job. The loan will be used for the purchase of flour, sugar and butter for the next delivery to the schools. Tayirjan is the only man in the solidarity group. He is 41 years old. His wife is a member of an agricultural collective. Tayirjan is involved in animal husbandry and milk and dairy products sales. The loan will be used for the purchase of one calf, which will then be sent to a mountain pasture. Sadathan is married and is raising 2 children. The oldest son is 28 years old. He is a construction worker. And the daughter is 22 years old. She is a homemaker. They have a family agricultural and animal husbandry business. Currently, they have 4 sheep. Also, they are getting ready for the planting of potatoes. The loan will be used for the purchase of 5 sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one calf

loans.name: Mukwano Jesica Musinga Group

texts.en: Jesica M. is a 35-year-old single mother of two children who all go to school. She has three additional dependents, one of whom goes to school. She has been in the business of selling clothes since 2008. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to obtain a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: LA SEÑORA YOLANDA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION TRABAJA EN LA INSTITUCION DESDE HACE SIETE AÑOS ATRAS, ES UN CLIENTE CON BUENA ACTITUD, TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE VIENDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA CALLE QUINTANILLA, SU NEGOCIO ES FIJO Y TRABAJA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO PARA LA ELABORACION DE SU COMIDA HASTA EL MEDIO DIA, LUEGO SE DEDICA A  LA LIMPIEZA DE SUS OLLAS, ELLA TIENE DOS HIJOS UNO ES MENOR QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y EL OTRO ES MAYOR,  EL MAYOR SE DEDICA AL PINTADO DE CASAS Y ARREGLO DE COMPUTADORAS, LA INVERSION QUE REALIZARA ES PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS E INGREDIENTES COMO ARROZ, ACEITE, PAPA, ETC. Y TAMBIEN OLLAS Y PLATOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS COMIDAS Y ASI BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a long-time client of the institution, who has been working with us for the past seven years. She is a hard working person with a good attitude who is always looking after the well being of her family. Yolanda sells food on Fifth Street. She has a permanent location and begins cooking very early in the morning and continues to the afternoon. She then spends time cleaning her pots and pans. She has two children, one of whom is school-aged and the other works as a house painter, and as a computer repairman. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients, such as rice, cooking oil, potatoes, etc. She will also buy some pots and plates in which to cook her food and be able to better serve her customers. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Leelawathi

texts.en:
Leelawathi is a 58-year-old unmarried woman living in the town of Telijjawila in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka.

Leelawathi has managed a rice paddy cultivation business for a long time with the help of her brother. 

She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help her with the rice paddy cultivation.  She is a very active, honest, and hard working woman. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka for the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy equipment for her rice paddy

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru: Холов Шукрулло проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, занимается растениеводством. Сам Шукрулло имеет среднее образование. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Shukrullo K. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is in agriculture. Shukrullo has secondary education and does animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home and has been in this field for fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan S. is from Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 35 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Jonathan owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. He has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP whenever he sells a raised animal. In 2008, Jonathan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. V. is a middle-age woman and the mother of a young child, who is enrolled in primary school. She has a financial earner in Her husband is also a financial earner, growing rice crops for the purpose of eating and selling. V. built a medium pig stall where she raises a lot of hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this field since she was single, so she has a lot of experience. Because her pig-raising trade is the main source of family income, she has obtained a loan to use as capital to buy pig feed and to buy many piglets for her pigpen.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and many piglets for her pigpen.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La señora Fidelia, tiene 33 años y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Rayanniyoc se encuentra ubicada no menos de media hora de la ciudad del Cusco. Los pobladores de la comunidad se  dedican a la ganadería y a la agricultura siendo estos sus principales fuentes de ingresos económicos. 

Su actividad económica principal de Fidelia es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cría gallinas, cría cuyes y muchos más. Los días sábados lleva a vender sus cuyes a la feria que se implosiva de forma ambulatoria en la avenida del Ejercito de la ciudad del Cusco. Fidelia también se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Rosaspata de la ciudad del Cusco.     

Fidelia pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le encanta las actividades que se realiza en cada reunión. Actualmente, Fidelia tiene 14 gallinas y desea aumentar el capital por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar más gallinas de color blanco.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 33 years old, and she has four children. She lives in the Rayanniyoc rural community in the Taray district, Calca province, Cusco department. Rayanniyoc is one half hour from the city of Cusco. The inhabitants of the community work with livestock and in farming. These are the main sources of income. Fidelia’s main economic activity is raising small animals. For example, she raises chickens, guinea pigs, and a lot more. On Saturday she takes her guinea pigs to sell at the fair. They are sold in an itinerant way on Ejercito Avenue in the city of Cusco. Fidelia also sells vegetables in the Rosaspata market in the city of Cusco. Fidelia belongs to the Villa Rayanniyoc Communal Bank of the Arariwa Asociación. She has participated in her communal bank for many years. She really likes the activities at each meeting. Fidelia currently has 14 hens, and she wants to increase her capital. That is why she needs a loan to buy more white hens.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more white hens

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 32 years old, is single, and has three children aged between 5 and 13 years. In addition to her children she looks after her siblings who are orphans. She lives in rented accommodation in Hoima, Uganda, and describes her household as an extended family.

Lydia is into a restaurant business and has been in it for seven years. She started by selling secondhand clothes and then later changed to her restaurant business. The biggest challenge she has is that her customers eat on credit and then default on the payment.
 
Lydia expects, in future to, acquire a TV, a fridge and a fan for her business. However, her family goal is to build her own home and stop renting. The purpose of the loan is to buy a plot of land to build on.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Benita's Group

texts.en:
Benita P. is from the village of Villa Imelda. She is 35 years old. Benita is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Benita P..

Benita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Benita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Benita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Benita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Benita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Viviana es conviviente, tiene un hijo que estudia en el jardín, Viviana viaja a las ferias de la región tres veces por semana en donde vende abarrotes en general y de las ferias compra cereales que luego los procesa en molino alquilado, producto que comercializa en los mercados.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y leche.
Los sueños de Viviana son comprar un terreno céntrico para la construcción de su casa en donde pueda establecer un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Communal bank. She has a live-in boyfriend and one son who is in kindergarten. She travels to the markets in the region three times a week where she sells basic supplies. She also buys grains here which she then processes in a rented mill. She then sells the grain at the markets. Viviana needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of sugar and milk. Viviana's dreams are to buy a centrally-located piece of land to build a house where she can establish a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and milk

loans.name: Chom's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine people, located in Preak Thmey village, Kandal province. Mrs. Chom S. is 40 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by the members of this village loan.
   
Mrs. Chom S. is a flower seller in the market and she also sells sausage and balut (eggs with almost developed embryos, boiled and eaten in the shell) at her home while her husband, Mr. Phum Vannak, 42 years old, is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate flowers. With their businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to support the flower selling, Mrs. Chom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy farm flowers and other flowers to enlarge her business activities. This couple has two children: one is a flower seller and another is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy farm flowers and other flowers to enlarge her business activities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Honest-Ii Group

texts.en:
Fatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatu was born in Magburaka town about thirty-five years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children, two in primary school and two in secondary school.

For a long period of time now, Fatu has been selling cooked rice (the country’s staple food). This is the first loan that Fatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil (the locally favorite cooking oil), etc. in large quantity. In this way, Fatu will stop buying retail, thereby saving her a lot of money.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A., age 48, sells a variety of different products in her local general store. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three adult children and live in the village of Cabaruan.
  
In 2009, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Nenita is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ruth  Wangare

texts.en:
Ruth Wangare N. has been in the business of selling new clothes for the last 11 years in Kangemi open air market, and she earns a good income. She has a stall where she sells her clothes; most of her customers are passersby and business people who deal with different business types that are located at the open-air market. 

Wangare is 29 years old and married to Peter Mwangi, 36 years old, who works as an accountant at a supermarket, and they are blessed with two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she has no history with any other MFI. Ruth is applying for her third loan of Kshs.25,000 which she intends to use to buy new clothes for sale as she targets the festive season.

In the future Wangare hopes to grow her business and run a large shopping mall and open a branch in Kikuyu.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes for resale during the festive season

loans.name: Stephen Ng'ang'a

texts.en:
Stephen is married to Salome and the father of two children who are two and ten years old. For the past four years, he has been operating a barber shop in Limuru town which is on the outskirts of Nairobi. Limuru is a relatively busy business location with a high population that is favorable for Stephen’s shop. 

Stephen got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. Stephen has not borrowed from other financiers before. He has applied for his first loan to buy building materials to build his own business premises instead of paying rent which is very costly.

Stephen’s desire is to give his children a better education and a better life.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Mehreen's Group

texts.en:
Mehreen is a resident of Multan, which is an historic city in Pakistan famous for its embroidery and cloth industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the Chowk Shaheedan area.

She is a caring lady and prefers to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities as a housewife.  Her husband operates a small canteen business. He runs a canteen outside of the school area and sells chips, samosas, cold drinks, biscuits, etc. which are very popular among students. He has been in this business for over 10 years and is getting good profits from his business every month.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve the business of her husband. With the loan, he will buy required items like cold drinks, chips, biscuits, etc. in a good quantity for selling to the students.
 
Mehreen hopes that an investment will result in good profits for her husband and that her family’s standard of living will be improved.  She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Mehreen.

loans.use: To buy items required for canteen business

loans.name: Gabriel Narciso

texts.es:
Gabriel de 56 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como policia municipal.

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de terminar la letrina de su casa y cercar el patio de la misma para asi de esta manera poder brindarle mayor seguridad y mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  

Sueña con ir mejorando poco a poco su casa y ofrecerle a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 56-year-old married man. He has been working for the Juigalpa Sheriff's Office for three years as a city policeman.

He is requesting his second loan in order to finish the bathroom in his house and to build a fence around his property. These projects will provide his family with greater safety and better living conditions.

His dream is to continue improving his house bit by bit and to offer his family the very best he can give them.

loans.use: Restroom construction

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Martha Cecilia A. R. vive en el barrio el Prado de la ciudad de Cartagena en compañía de su esposo y una hija de 9 años. Ese barrio es muy tradicional y famoso por ser el escenario de uno de los mejores desfiles folclóricos que se realizan en la semana del 11 de noviembre, cada año. La microempresaria se dedica a fabricar fritos como empanadas, arepas, deditos de queso y buñuelos. El negocio comenzó hace 15 años por recomendación de su mamá e impulsada por el hecho de querer generar otros ingresos familiares. Al principio utilizaba sólo un caldero pequeño, pero con el incremento de las ventas debió comprar otros implementos de cocina más grandes. Actualmente emplea a dos mujeres que le colaboran en preparar todos los ingredientes que llevan los fritos. Todos los días la señora Martha se levanta a las 3:30 de la mañana para iniciar su jornada laboral, porque debe entregar su producción a 7 tiendas del barrio y una cafetería antes de las 8 A.M.  Este es el quinto crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de una estufa industrial, una nevera e insumos para preparar sus productos. En promedio, la microempresaria vende 250 fritos a un precio de $500 COP cada uno. El margen de utilidad es del 40%. La señora Martha informa que gracias a su actividad  le está colaborando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, puede darle su hija una buena educación y algunas comodidades que ella nunca tuvo cuando niña. Ella cree que el éxito de su negocio está en la calidad de los ingredientes que utiliza y el conocimiento de la temperatura que debe tener el aceite de cocina para poder  freír  y lograr que todo quede delicioso y crocante.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia A. R. lives in the El Prado neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena, together with her husband and 9 year-old daughter.  This neighborhood is very traditional and famous for being the scene of one of the best folk parades which takes place on November 11th every year.

This small businesswoman makes fried goods such as empanadas, 'arepas' (corn fritters), 'deditos de queso' ('little cheese fingers') and doughnuts.  She started her business 15 years ago.  It was her mom who suggested the business and Martha was motivated by the fact that she wanted to make some additional family income.  At first she used only a small pot for preparing her food but as her sales increased she had to buy other, bigger cooking implements.  She currently employs two women who help her to prepare all the ingredients for her fried goods.

Every day Martha gets up at 3.30am to start her work day because she must deliver her goods to seven stores in the neighborhood and a cafeteria before 8.00am.

This is Martha's fifth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying an industrial stove, a refrigerator and supplies for preparing her food.  She sells on average 250 fried products at 500 Colombian pesos each.  Her profit margin is 40%.  Martha informs us that, thanks to her business, she is able to help her husband with their household expenses, provide her daughter with a good education and also some small conveniences that she never had when she was a little girl.  She believes that the success of her business lies in the quality of the ingredients that she uses and knowing the right temperature at which to have the cooking oil when she fries so that everything turns out delicious and crispy.

loans.use: To buy an industrial stove, a fridge and supplies for preparing her products

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en:
Nadera is the mother of two daughters and two sons. Her sons own a barber shop in the city of Jenin. Both of her sons are married and provide for their families as well as for their mother and their sisters, who are still students.

Nadera took a loan from FATEN to help her sons improve the barber shop by painting the walls and replacing one of the old barber chairs in the shop.

Nadera's son Raed appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: Paint the shop and purchase a barber chair

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by raising hogs. She lives in Amlan, Negros Oriental. Teresita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Teresita is borrowing 10,000 PHP so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her fifteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Jhon Henrri

texts.es: Jhon tiene 33 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y su menor hija de 07 años en casa de sus padres el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente aproximadamente ocho años actualmente cuenta con mototaxi  propia en la cual trabaja de forma independiente el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para  invertir en un negocio de comida ya que su esposa tiene experiencia por haber trabajado como ayudante de cocina, se le propone el crédito por tener buenas referencias,voluntad de capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jhon is 33 years old, married, and lives at the home of his parents with his wife and seven year old daughter. He started working as a hired driver approximately eight years ago, but he now has his own motorcycle taxi so that he can work independently.

The loan being provided will be invested in a food business since his wife has experience working as a kitchen assistant. Jhon is being recommended for this loan because he has good references as well as the willingness and capacity to make repayments.

loans.use: Invest in a food business that his wife will manage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local food for resale

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Anita;  La socia tiene 33 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 1 año de edad; La socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella trabaja realizando trabajos en arcilla y otras artesanías la socia las compra, ella se dedica la compra y venta de mercadería y también elaboración de la misma, la socia tiene su pequeño stand en el poblado de Ollantaytambo. La socia desea el cerdito para comprar mercadería y para comprar arcillas y óxidos naturales para los diseños de la cerámica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materiales.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Anita is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 16 and 1.  She is in the handicrafts business.  She makes products from clay and also buys other handicrafts.  She buys and sells merchandise and also makes her own products.  Anita has a small stand in the town of Ollantaytambo.  She would like this loan to buy merchandise with.  She will also buy clay and natural oxides for making designs on her pottery.

Anita is requesting this loan to buy merchandise and materials.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and materials

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha S. (pictured) is 32 years old and his wife, Mrs. Em Van, is 31 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2003 and have two daughters. One attends school and the other is still young.    

Sokhon sells pigs; he buys them from his village and the nearby villages and resells to a slaughter house. His wife is garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase more pigs to resell.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is 58 years old and married. Norma has been growing rice for more than 30 years. She earns her living by selling her harvest to the market. Norma has children who are still in school. She works hard to sustain their education and provide them better futures.

Norma's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Reina Beatriz

texts.es: Reina Beatriz Q. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo y un hijo en el Municipio D. San Martin del  Departamento D. San Salvador. Doña Reina posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una tienda en la que ofrece productos D. primera necesidad como: bebidas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, detergente, jabón, etc. Tiene mucho tiempo D. trabajar en su tienda y gracias a su carisma  y dedicación en el trabajo ha logrado posicionarse en la zona y cada día su clientela aumenta más. Es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos ya que ella siempre se preocupa por brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Su sueño es  ampliar su tiendita surtiéndola con variedad D. productos. Por esta razón solicita este crédito con la esperanza puesta en Dios que logrará atraer a más clientes que le demanden sus productos y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Con el crédito pretenD. comprar variedad D. artículos D. primera necesidad como: golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, entre otros artículos atractivos para los clientes. D. esta manera espera lograr mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia y ayudar a su hijo a superarse.
texts.en: Reina Beatriz Q. D. M. is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son in the San Martin municipality of the San Salvador department.  Doña Reina has a small business which consists of a store in which she carries basic products such as beverages, rice, beans, sugar, candy, detergents, soap, etc..  She has been working at this store for some time and thanks to her charisma and dedication she has been able to position herself in the area, and her customer base increases every day.  She is well known and respected by her neighbors as she always makes sure to proviD. the best service possible to her customers.  Her dream is to grow her store by supplying it with a variety of products.  For this reason she is requesting this loan, with her hope placed in God's hands she expects to attract more customer that will need her merchandise and this way obtain larger profits. With the money from the loan she will buy a variety of basic products such as candy, beverages,rice, sugar beans, soap, detergent, toilet paper and other articles that will attract customers.  In this way she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family and help her son to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic products such as candies, sodas, rice, sugar, beans, soap, detergents,toilet paper among other merchandise desired by the customers.

loans.name: Saba Saba Group

texts.en:
Abdllah M., who is in his early 50s, is married with five children. Some of the children are still in school. He has been selling second clothes and second hand shoes since 1982.  He works from 8:30am to 6:30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Abdllah's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start selling second hand shoes and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock of second hand clothes and shoes. His dream is to one day have a big place where he can sell his products.

Abdlla will share this loan with his loan group "Saba saba", which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Abdllah is in the middle of the last row in a black shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock of second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Deivis

texts.es: Deivis es un joven de 29 años que vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 16 años y 4 meses  en Ciudad Bicentenario, macroproyecto objeto de intervención de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su ejercicio misional  de construir comunidades auto sostenibles.  Desde allí Deivis  ofrece sus servicios como técnico en pulimento de vehículos, actividad que inició cuando buscando ingresos para su hogar,  decidió ofrecer sus servicios de lavado de  vehículos por  principales avenidas de la ciudad, pero como Deivis es un joven de muchas aspiraciones logró dar otro  matiz , una vez  realizó estudios de pulimiento y mantenimiento externo de vehículos, logrando su título como técnico en esta actividad, en la que se desempeña con mucho esmero y sueña con hacerla crecer, porque más adelante su meta es tener un local propio para aumentar su reconocimiento, ofreciendo servicios más efectivos a sus clientes y con ello lograr aumentar sus ingresos, con tal de fomentar el bienestar de su familia y ofrecerle una educación de calidad a  sus hijos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  con él comprará materias primas para la preparación de productos de limpieza y cera para el pulimiento de vehículos. Su mayor desafío es atender a sus clientes sin tener  un puesto fijo, por eso todos los días trabaja con el fin de ahorrar y lograr un espacio bien organizado donde desarrollar su actividad.
texts.en:
Deivis is a young man who is 29 years of age. He lives with his wife and their two children (ages 16 and 4 months) in Ciudad Bicentenario, a large-scale housing and intervention project undertaken by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The mission of this project is to build self-sustaining communities.

In this community, Deivis offers car wash services. He started this business because he needed a way to earn household income. Deivis decided to offer his services to vehicles that travel along the main avenues of the city. Being a young man with many aspirations started to give him more purpose. As soon he completed courses in polishing and maintaining vehicle exteriors, he became certified as a technician to work in this type of business. His skill is demonstrated through the great care he takes in making his business grow. Going forward his goal is to have his own location where can he can attract more business, offer more effective services to his customers, and generate more income to help him provide for the welfare of his family and pay for a quality education for his children.

This Kiva loan is his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Deivis will use the funds to buy materials for preparing cleaning products and car wax for polishing vehicles. His greatest challenge is attending to his customers without having an established location. For this reason, he works every day so that he can save toward acquiring an organized space where he can develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning materials and car wax.

loans.name: Olin

texts.es: Olin, de 21 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado con Yeny, de 19 años, producto de su gran amor nació Oliver que ahora tiene 10 meses de nacido; los tres viven en su casa alquilada ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Punpuriani). Todas las mañanas, desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a su terreno de cultivo, donde cuida plátanos y yuca; que hace dos años viene plantando con mucho esmero y cuidado y que muy pronto podrá cosechar plátanos para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que vienen constantemente a la comunidad. Según cuenta, tiene 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que la sustentan económicamente y el cual se cosecha cada 15 días, produciéndole constantemente ganancias. Lo que más le gusta es poder ver como su esfuerzo tiene buenos resultados, a pesar de tener poco tiempo en la agricultura. De las 3 cuadras de terreno que posee le falta uno para ser sembrado, por lo que sembrará café y muy pronto construirá una casa para su esposa y su hijo. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para disponer del capital para continuar con su trabajo agrícola. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Olin de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Olin, 21, is a good and hardworking man. He is married to Yeny, 19, and out of their great love was born Oliver who is now 10 months old. The three of them live in a rented house located in the Peruvian jungle (native community of Punpuriani Center). Each morning at dawn he goes to his plot of land where he is tending bananas and yucca, having begun planting with a lot of effort and care two years ago. He will be able to harvest bananas very soon in order to sell them to the merchants that regularly visit the community. According to Olin he has two hectares of agricultural land that support him economically and which he harvests every two weeks, bringing in regular profits. 

What he likes most is to see how his effort brings good results, in spite of having only worked in agriculture a short while. Of the three blocks of land he owns, one remains to be sowed. He plans to sow coffee plants, and very soon will build a house for his wife and son. Thus he hopes for the support of each of you in order to have the capital he needs to continue on in his farming work. 

He belongs to the communal bank "Abejitas de Pumpuriani" [Little Bees of Pumpuriani]. This is his second loan with MFP, where he hopes for a small loan with which to achieve his objectives. Therefore he promises once again to make his payments as he did with his previous loans. He is pleased to be a member of his communal bank because all of its members are responsible people and mutually supportive. Once he receives his support, Olin will invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of organic compost for spreading on the land where his coffee crop was recently sowed.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Jameelan's Group

texts.en:
Jameelan is married and has no children. To pass her time and to help her husband financially, she operates a sewing business. She learned this skill from her mother in her teenage years and now she is good at it. She receives orders from her community clients and earns well after completing the orders on time. She also knows how to do embroidery but doesn’t do it on a regular basis. 

Her husband has a business doing floor polishing. He has a polishing machine and he uses it to polish floors. He is very good at his work and provides services to his customers for a reasonable fee. 

Jameelan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish orders on time. Her current machine has become old and takes much time to sew a single dress. 

She has been operating her business for the past six years and is very hopeful that the investment will help her in making her business more profitable. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Edwin
